description: Hours of Simon de Varie; Jean Fouquet (French, born about 1415 - 1420, died before 1481), and Dunois Master (French, active Paris, France until 1463), and Master of Jean Rolin II (Hand B) (French, active Paris, France last third of 14th century); Paris (perhaps), France; 1455; Tempera colors, gold paint, gold leaf, and ink on parchment bound between pasteboard covered with red morocco with olive and citron morocco inlays; Leaf: 11.4 × 8.3 cm (4 1/2 × 3 1/4 in.); Ms. 7; Partial gift of Gerald F. Borrmann; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California

maker: Jean Fouquet, and Dunois Master, and Master of Jean Rolin II (Hand B)
medium: Tempera colors, gold paint, gold leaf, and ink on parchment bound between pasteboard covered with red morocco with olive and citron morocco inlays
name: Hours of Simon de Varie
title: Hours of Simon de Varie
